title: Java Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your Java programming knowledge from the basics

questions.question: What is the correct way to define a Java class?
questions.explanation: 'public class MyClass { }' is the correct syntax. The 'class' keyword is required, and we often use the 'public' access modifier.

questions.question: In Java, all primitive types have a default value of 0 or false.
questions.explanation: True. Primitive types (int, boolean, etc.) automatically get default values: numbers get 0, boolean gets false.

questions.question: Which is NOT a primitive type in Java?
questions.explanation: String is an object type, not primitive. int, boolean, and char are all primitive types.

questions.question: The main() method must have public and static modifiers.
questions.explanation: True. The main() method must have the signature 'public static void main(String[] args)'.

questions.question: What happens when there are no more references to an object?
options: It's automatically deleted by the Garbage Collector
questions.explanation: The Garbage Collector automatically frees objects that have no more references to them.
